thread.title: Air India cabin crew member arrested for smuggling 1.7 kg of gold worth over ₹1 cr, Air India, gold smuggling, Chennai airport, customs, arrest, cabin crew, Dubai, smuggler

author: @english_mathrubhumi
title: Air India cabin crew member arrested for smuggling 1.7 kg of gold worth over ₹1 cr, Air India, gold smuggling, Chennai airport, customs, arrest, cabin crew, Dubai, smuggler
text:
17 December 2024, 05:49 PM IST 1 min read Read later Print Share More More An Air India crew member was arrested in Chennai for smuggling 1.7 kg of gold worth over ₹1 crore. The gold was concealed in undergarments. Passenger also arrested. X Representational image
Chennai: An Air India cabin crew member was arrested in Chennai for allegedly smuggling 1.7 kilograms of gold valued at over ₹1 crore. The gold was handed over to the cabin crew member by a passenger who had travelled on a flight from Dubai to Chennai. Customs officials have not yet released the details of the passenger or the cabin crew member.
To advertise here, Contact Us The gold was found concealed in undergarments. The passenger involved in the incident has also been arrested. According to Customs, the plan was for the passenger to hand over the gold to the cabin crew member, who would then deliver it to someone outside the airport upon arrival.
